item.title: Rubbish Overflowing. Maggots and Mice Infestation. Flytipping from surrounding restaurants., 15th August
item.description:
There has been a persistent issue with overflowing bins and rubbish buildup outside 22 Milkwood Road. Iâ€™ve been reporting this to Lambeth Council since last year with no lasting solution. The area is now infested with mice (inside and outside the property) and there are maggots directly outside our front door due to rotting food waste. Several young children and babies live in the building, and the conditions are a serious health hazard. Nearby restaurants also appear to be dumping commercial waste in our bins, worsening the problem. Immediate action is needed!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milkwood Road, Loughborough Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic light stuck on red, 15th August
item.description:
I would like to report a serious issue with the temporary traffic lights currently in place. The lights appear to be stuck on red, causing confusion and congestion. This poses a significant risk of accidents, especially during busy periods. Drivers have been beeping and attempting to proceed without clear signals, which increases the danger for both road users and pedestrians. Please could this be addressed as a matter of urgency to ensure public safety. Location: Albany street - Towards towards Cumberland terrace (near Chester gate) Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chester Close South, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can dead pigeon feathers be cleared up please?, 15th August
item.description:
A bird was presumably killed here and lots of feathers are in the playground. Can these be removed please? Kids were playing with them over a week ago so definitely time to remove please? Aware fencing issues here already reported, but can whole play area be inspected? Its looking very run down and in need of some attention asap. Banked up areas looking a real state and probably dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2C, Imperial Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Health hazard that is attracting vermin and unsightly, 14th August
item.description:
Is I can see from you Previous page that Tenants and homeowners have made Southwark council aware of this on going problem that you stated Southwark Council is aware of why has nothing been done about the Constant literaring on Pioneer Street se15 5qh And And fly tipping of the hedgerows That is being leftTo the festive. Not only are we Bombarded with food waste we are now having Nitrous gas cylinders left along the side of the road. Were people put up in their vehicles and sit there for hours taking their nitrous gas. I have lived here for a year and half and I have only Witnessed the hedgerows being cleaned when the hedgerows being cut. This is just not good enough. We are in desperate need of a cleaning service on a regular basis. Hope to hear from you soon Miss Hutton 32 pioneer street se15 5qh

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pioneer Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
